channel.title: Need help! rep++
channel.description:
[center]I purchased a VPS from: VPSDEPOT.com
I uploaded all of my server files, but now I don't know how to run the run.bat file making it so other can play my server!
If someone can help, that'd be great.
I [b]will [/b]use teamviewer if that is easier for you.[/center]

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-land Chaotic-land
item.description:
@Chaotic-land wrote:

This is a guide havent tested it thought but hopefully it will help you.

http://vpsbible.com/hosting/setup-vps-linux-distribution/

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“JGX, post:7, topic:433600”]I apologize.

I feel as if I would have saved your fingers from typing all of that.

My VPS, like a lot of other VPS’ OS is Linux. That is why i’m a bit confused as to what to do.

JAVA is installed on my VPS.

Can you just connect to my TV and have a look at it?[/quote]

Ahh. Linux. You should have mentioned that. Sorry, I have no clue.

Umm.

There should be some sort of Linux version of remote desktop that you can connect to.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

I apologize.

I feel as if I would have saved your fingers from typing all of that.

My VPS, like a lot of other VPS’ OS is Linux. That is why i’m a bit confused as to what to do.
JAVA is installed on my VPS.

Also, I never said I needed to EDIT my run.bat file, but to be able to (OPEN) or USE it within the VPS.

Can you just connect to my TV and have a look at it?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“JGX, post:5, topic:433600”]Lol… wow.

Well, I can run it fine at home. On a VPS is much more different. I don’t even know how to use the VPS other than just adding files to it through FileZilla.

Instead of criticizing me, you can help me?

The only thing I need to know is how do I run the run.bat file making it so players can log in?[/quote]

If you’re using Windows, it’s almost identical to the standard W7 platform that everyone has.

Are you even on remote desktop?

If you have installed Java correctly, you don’t need to edit your damn run.bat file.

Basically, take the same measures you would do at home. It’s not difficult.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Lol… wow.

Well, I can run it fine at home. On a VPS is much more different. I don’t even know how to use the VPS other than just adding files to it through FileZilla.

Instead of criticizing me, you can help me?

The only thing I need to know is how do I run the run.bat file making it so players can log in?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

JGX:

I know how to run a server… Just not on a VPS…

If you can run it at home (java, firewall, portforward, paths, bam, done), then you can definitely do it on someone else’s computer. On a VPS, you don’t even need to portforward! Doesn’t that make life much easier? Wow, this is so great.

In response to your edit: MSTSC.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

I know how to run a server… Just not on a VPS…

It’s not like I can just double click on the Run.bat in the VPS CPannel and it will run…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! rep++
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Come on, man. Learn how to run a server before you purchase a VPS.

Read full topic
